definitions.definition: A mathematical statement of some importance that has been proven to be true . Minor theorems are often called propositions . Theorems which are not very interesting in themselves but are an essential part of a bigger theorem's proof are called lemmas .
A mathematical statement that is expected to be true .
examples: Fermat's Last Theorem was known thus long before it was proved in the 1990s.
was known thus long before it was proved in the 1990s.

definitions.definition: A syntactically correct expression that is deducible from the given axioms of a deductive system .

main_definition: ( mathematics ) A mathematical statement of some importance that has been proven to be true . Minor theorems are often called propositions . Theorems which are not very interesting in themselves but are an essential part of a bigger theorem's proof are called lemmas .
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics , colloquial , nonstandard ) A mathematical statement that is expected to be true .
( logic ) A syntactically correct expression that is deducible from the given axioms of a deductive system .
